text: you know really from the beginning I
wanted to be outside of the world of
fashion being on my own was very
important and I think it it will always
be important I don't like a lot of stuff
and it's just not my thing there are
specific things that I'd like to be
across all my spaces that being the
trots of floor in the blinds and gray
marble walls I don't have mood boards
around I don't have literal references
for collections I like not having them
in front of me because you forget enough
about it that it's easier to make it
your own the tailoring aspect of what I
do I think is very in tune with the way
that I live
gray is a color that I use in every
collection for me there is a lot of
color within the world of gray almost
timeless color I never thought I would
reference my father as much as I do
he wore a suit every day because he
just did he never thought about clothing
in that was just something that he wore
I love to almost keep pushing the idea
of almost uniformity and the idea of
maybe not as much choice I think there's
something really refreshing when you
know things don't change as much
we all dress very similarly I mean
that's a big conversation because I like
people to come to work and feel like
they are entering into what they're
designing for of course I want to be
professional and I think that's
important but I do like that everybody
feels like I'm almost like their father
I do love being with my design stuff and
that's where I prefer to be but there
there are things I have to do within my
own office it almost represents the more
serious side of what I have to do a lot
of the furniture does move around from
the store of my apartment to here I am
the worst sketcher but I do have
conceptual sketches for looks in the
show I like to challenge myself and I
like to challenge everybody here in a
way that we're doing something that is
very special I like to put interesting
ideas in front of people and as a
designer I think that's what I'm
supposed to be doing
Oh
